## UnicodeUtils.rtlMirroredCodePoints variable

Some punctuation characters (like: (, ), &lt;<!-- -->, &gt;<!-- -->, \[,\], {<!-- -->, }<!-- -->) need to be mirrored when rendering a RTL string to preserve their intrinsic meaning. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic\_Latin\_(Unicode\_block)\#Table\_of\_characters

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
rtlMirroredCodePoints: number[]
```
